result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared A Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2 letters filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jared A Jacobson in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, 2 and 3,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- Sentence withheld for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 2 and 3
- Fine totaling $442.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply bail
- Transcript fee of $10.00 to be paid to the DA's office as a Condition of Probation - apply bail
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply bail
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No contact with Trevor B. Defendant to write letter of apology to the victim and letter to be given to the victim through the Agent. No use/possession of firearms. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol.

Ct.  2:
- Sentence withheld for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 1 and 3

Defendant Jared A Jacobson in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense withdraws their motion. Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing date. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on January 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jared A Jacobson in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  
(2) Motions filed by Atty. LeBell - To Dismiss (insufficiency of the information) and To Supress Physical Evidence.

Matter was originally scheduled for the Motion filed by Atty. LaBell.
State just provided some discovery to the defense.
Parties may have a resolution to this matter, therefore, both side request a 30 days adjournment to resolve this matter.
State also needs time to discuss the possible resolution with the victim.
Atty. Boese presented statements to the court.
Atty. Lebell presented statements to the court.
